intro: Hieracium caucasiense subsp. acutangulum, commonly known as the Caucasus hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and daisy-like yellow flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its acute, sharply pointed leaf margins and bracts. It typically grows in mountainous areas and is adapted to cooler, temperate climates. This plant is often found in meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
